info.description: Provides generic network configuration related functionalities of ctrlX OS.
info.title: ctrlX OS - Connectivity API

400.description: The request is incomplete or malformed

401.description: Not authorized to access this resource

500.description: Something unexpected happened on the server

get.summary: List all firewall tables of a specific framework, e.g. nftables

framework.description: The framework from which the data should be received. It can be nftables, iptables, ip6tables
framework.name: framework

BadRequest.description: The request is incomplete or malformed

Unauthorized.description: Not authorized to access this resource

InternalServerError.description: Something unexpected happened on the server

autoconnect.description: if true, autoconnect for this ssid is enabled

state.description: Show the current state for the ssid, e.g. wrong password, general problem, ...

VlanConfig.description: Represents the configuration of a VLAN interface

priority.description: Enum to handle priorities of messages.

Interface.description: Static properties and status information of an interface

name.description: The name of the interface (maximal length 15 character, must not contain whitespaces)

hardwareAddress.description: The hardware address of the interface. For ethernet based networks, the hardware address may be referred to as the mac address.

link.description: Boolean that describes the current link status of an interface

disabled.description: Boolean that determines the current status of an interface

ipForwarding.description: Enables ip forwarding for network interface

Kinds.description: Enum to differentiate between numerous network interfaces.

ArpProtocolHardwareId.description: Arp protocol hardware identifier of interface. Only ethernet devices are editable

InterfaceConfiguration.description: Presents the configuration of an interface

disabled.description: Boolean that describes if the interface should be disabled

dhcp4.description: Boolean that describes if IPv4 DHCP client should be enabled (not supported in mode 'accessPoint' )

dhcp6.description: Boolean that describes if IPv6 DHCP client should be enabled (not supported in mode 'accessPoint' )

ipv4Address.description: A list of static ipv4 addresses in CIDR notation

ipv6Address.description: A list of static ipv6 addresses in CIDR notation

gateway4.description: Gateway to access the network over IPv4 (not supported in mode 'accessPoint' )

gateway6.description: Gateway to access the network over IPv6 (not supported in mode 'accessPoint' )

managed.description: Describes whether a network interfaces is managed or not. By default every network interface is not managed.

linkLocalIpv4.description:
Set the link local configuration for ipv4 of the interface.
With linkLocalIpv4=true, the interface gets an additional ip address in the range 169.254.0.0/16

mtu.description:
Set the mtu size of the interface, changing mtu size requires reboot!
Value is only valid, if no mtu is received from dhcp.
If mtu should be changed when mtu value is provided by dhcp, dhcp override useMtu has to be set to false

useDns.description: Receive dns servers from dhcp server

useNtp.description: Receive ntp servers from dhcp server

useMtu.description: MTU received from the DHCP server will be set as the MTU of the network interface. If user defined mtu should be used, this value has to be false

routeMetric.description: Use this value for default metric for automatically-added routes. Use this to prioritize routes for devices by setting a lower metric on a preferred interface

DhcpIdentifiers.description: Select dhcp identifier from rfc4361 or mac address. "mac" is required for windows dhcp servers with ipv4 address reservation

IpAddress.description: Can be either a Ipv4 or Ipv6 Address containing information about static, dynamic or fixed ip addresses

IpAddressKinds.description: Enum to differentiate between numerous kinds of IpAddresses

destination.description: Destination address or address space (CIDR Notation) for which this route is used. Default route is written as 0.0.0.0/0

gateway.description: Gateway which will be used to connect to the target network

metric.description: (optional) Metric indicates the associated cost of using the indicated route

items.description: The address of the name server

TaskPing.description: Execute a ping from the server

TaskArp.description: Execute an arp request for an address or address range

TaskCheckHttp.description: Do a http request with proxy settings. If no proxy is defined, the system proxy settings are used

path.description: The path to the dump file

networkInterface.description: Network interface used for the dump

duration.description: Duration of the dump in seconds

remainingTime.description: Remaining time of the dump in seconds

duration.description: Duration of the dump in seconds

bypass.description: Comma separated list of hosts to bypass proxy settings

username.description: Proxy authentication user's name or login

enabled.description: if true, security configuration is enabled.

hostname.description: Host names may contain only alphanumeric characters, minus signs ('-'), and periods ('.'). They must begin with an alphabetic character and end with an alphanumeric character.

aliases.description: Optional aliases provide for name changes, alternate spellings, shorter hostnames, or generic hostnames (for example, localhost)

interval.description: Gratuitous arp message interval in seconds

onStartup.description: Send gratuitous arp messages on startup

count.description: Number of gratuitous arp messages, only positive values are valid, otherwide default is used

Services.description: A list of all network discovery Services

example.name: bandwidthLimit_eth0
example.description: Limit bandwidth of eth0 to 500 mbytes/s

name.description:
The name of the bandwidth policy.
It is a string that uniquely identifies the bandwidth policy.
The name of a bandwidth policy must adhere to the specified pattern and must be between 1 and 32 characters in length.

description.description: The description of the bandwidth policy
description.example: Limit bandwidth of eth0 to 500 mbytes/s

Problem.description: This document defines a "problem detail" as a way  to carry machine-readable details of errors in a  HTTP response to avoid the need to define new error  response formats for HTTP APIs.

type.description:
A URI reference [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type. 
This specification encourages that, when dereferenced, 
it provide human-readable documentation for the problem type 
(e.g., using HTML [W3C.REC-html5-20141028]). When this member 
is not present, its value is assumed to be "about:blank".

title.description:
A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. 
It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, 
except for purposes of localization (e.g., using proactive content 
negotiation; see [RFC7231], Section 3.4).
If the response is a diagnostics message, it contains 
the text associated with the mainDiagnosisCode.
title.example: You do not have enough credit.

status.description:
The HTTP status code ([RFC7231], Section 6) generated by the 
origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description:
A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.
If the response is a diagnostics message, it contains the text associated with
the detailedDiagnosisCode.
detail.example: Your current balance is 30, but that costs 50.

instance.description:
A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.
It may or may not yield further information if dereferenced.

code.description:
An error code issued by the system that caused the original problem.
This code can be used to track down the root cause of the error.

mainDiagnosisCode.description:
The main diagnosis code is issued by the system that caused the problem.
This code can be used to track down the root cause and source of the error.
It can be used to search in the documentation for a solution.
It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the same problem.

detailedDiagnosisCode.description:
The detailed diagnosis code issued by the system that caused the problem.
This code can be used to track down the detailed cause and source of the error.
It can be used to search in the documentation for a solution.
The detailed diagnosis code gives additional information about the cause of the error.
It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the same problem.

dynamicDescription.description:
A dynamic description gives detailed information about the occurrence of a problem.
It can change between different occurrences of the same error.

severity.description: Severity of a problem as defined RFC5424 of the Syslog standard, see https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5424

links.description:
Collection of links to fix the problem. E.g. links to online user manual,
to an online community (using tags) or a developer chat (e.g. Slack).

moreInfo.description:
The moreInfo field allows you to add additional information that might be necessary to debug or trace down the cause of an error.
It might also contain information what is needed to resolve the problem.
There are loosely specified fields for specific problems that can be used in these situations, e.g.:
- On a 403 Forbidden error: The moreInfo can contain a field "requiredPermissions" with the required permissions seperated by comma
- On a 402 Payment required: The moreInfo can contain a field "requiredLicenses" with the required licenses seperated by comma

cause.description:
Sometimes a problem might be caused by problems that occure in other components or are the root cause of a problem. In this
case the related problems can be added as a cause. Since it might be possible that multiple components have problems on a single
action, cause is an array. E.g. Loading failed because several components where not able to load the configuration.

transmissionSpeed.description: Negotiated transfer rate of network interface in MBit

PathMtuDiscoveryMode.description: Enum to differentiate between path mtu discovery modes

IpConfigurationSettings.description: Setting of path mtu discovery modes

maxFileSize.description: Maximum file size for the tcpdump (in MB)

FirewallTablesText.description: All firewall tables of a specific framework as plain/text.

Modes.description:
Enum of interface mode. The modes 'client' and 'accesspoint' are only available for wireless interfaces. Changing
between client and accessPoint leeds to deleting of the existing configuration.

Protocol.description: Protocol to be used for the Double Attached Node (DAN). It can be either Parallel Redundancy Protocol (prp) or High-availability Seamless Redundancy (hsr).

address.description: Dns name or ip address to ping

addresses.description: Addresses or address ranges to do arp requests

count.description: Number of arp messages per request

ArpResult.description: Arp response, list of mac addresses by ip address

MacAddresses.description: The mac addresses for each arp request. If there are more than one mac address, there is an ip address conflict in the net segment

CheckHttpResult.description: The result of the http check

statusCode.description: Http status code of check request

rtt.description: Round trip time of check request in milliseconds

Status.description: The status of the TCP dump

AuthMethodConfigurationTypes.description: Enum to authentication methods configuration types

privateKey.description: file name of client private key

encryptedPrivateKeyPassword.description: encrypted password of client private key

protocol.description: Protocol of route, e.g. dhcp, static, kernel

id.description: A server generated ID used to identify the task. This ID is unique.

action.description: The action name executed by this task. This has to be inherited and overwritten by the application.

progress.description: Optional progress of the task in percentage.

parameters.description: Optional map of additional parameters required by the request. Should be defined when inherited by an application.

result.description: Optional map reflecting the result of the task. May be empty until task completition. Should be defined when inherited by an application.

ssid.description: The ssid of the wireless network

vlanId.description: id of the vlan interface (range 0 to 4094)

interface1.description:
First physical interface to be used for Double Attached Node (DAN) redundancy.
Bridges, VLAN and Wifi interfaces may not be used.

interface2.description:
Second physical interface to be used for Double Attached Node (DAN) redundancy.
Bridges, VLAN and Wifi interfaces may not be used.

address.description: Dns name or ip address to ping - deprecated, please use parameters

interval.description: Seconds between sending ping requests - deprecated, please use parameters

count.description: Number of ping retries - deprecated, please use parameters
